title: Nemanja Vidic names four best Premier League strikers he faced
text:
In eight years at Manchester United, Nemanja Vidic came across his fair share of bruising centre-forwards.

The Serbian won five Premier League titles between 2006 and 2014 but didn't have it all his own way during his time there.

He was famously embarrassed by Fernando Torres on more than one occasion, but surprisingly the former Liverpool striker doesn't feature among the four best strikers he played against in England.

Nemanja Vidic includes Peter Crouch as one of the four toughest strikers he faced in England

The Serbian defender first faced Crouch in an FA Cup tie at Anfield back in February 2006

Instead it's a former team-mate of the Spaniard's that first comes to mind for the 37-year-old.

'My first experience was Peter Crouch. I'd never seen a two-metres tall player before', he told The Athletic.

'He played for Liverpool and we played them in a cup game at Anfield. I was thinking "Wow, what can I do today with this guy?"

'Then I saw Bellamy next to him, not a great player on the ball but very, very fast. He would run into space, Crouch would jump into the air. I'd never seen football played like this.

Vidic was left for dead by Fernando Torres in March 2009, a 4-1 defeat where he was sent off

Vidic had praised for Chelsea striker Didier Drogba, who he met on a number of occasions

Vidic claimed Manchester United's 4-1 defeat at rivals City in 2013 was his worst game

'I'd never had a No 9 and a sharp, fast, player next to him. I knew how to deal with them individually but not both of them at the same time. I played alongside Wes Brown, it was a tough game, a long game. We lost 1-0.'

Vidic also praised the other three forwards on his list, Didier Drogba, Sergio Aguero and Luis Suarez.

He called Chelsea legend Drogba a 'very clever player who would get into the brain of the defenders.'

Vidic adds when talking about Aguero, that the 4-1 defeat at Manchester City in 2013 was his worst game for United.

For Suarez, he pinpointed his 'instinct' and energy for getting the better of his opponents.
description: In eight trophy-laden years at Manchester United, Nemanja Vidic came across his fair share of bruising centre-forwards.
